  • Method Details

    • time

      public DoorToggleRequestBuilder.IBuilder time(double time)
      Description copied from interface: DoorToggleRequestBuilder.IBuilder
      Optional: Sets the time value of the toggle request.
      Specified by:
      time in interface DoorToggleRequestBuilder.IBuilder
      Parameters:
      time - The duration (in seconds) of the toggle animation. Because the maximum speed of the animated blocks is limited, there is a lower bound limit of this value. The exact limit depends on the type and dimensions of the door.

      A value of 0 (default) allows the mover to figure out the time on its own.

      Returns:
      The next step of the guided builder process.

    • skipAnimation

      public DoorToggleRequestBuilder.IBuilder skipAnimation(boolean skip)
      Description copied from interface: DoorToggleRequestBuilder.IBuilder
      Optional: Skips the animation.

      If this method is called, the animation will be skipped, and the blocks will be moved from their old positions to the new ones immediately. This allows toggling doors without spawning any entities.

      This is useful for when there aren't any players nearby to witness the animation anyway, as opening the door without playing the animation avoids the heavy performance impact of spawning and animating entities.

      Specified by:
      skipAnimation in interface DoorToggleRequestBuilder.IBuilder
      Returns:
      The next step of the guided builder process.

    • responsible

      public DoorToggleRequestBuilder.IBuilder responsible(@Nullable @Nullable IPPlayer responsible)
      Description copied from interface: DoorToggleRequestBuilder.IBuilder
      Sets the player responsible for the toggle. When the toggle was not caused by a player this value is optional.

      However, this value is required if the toggle was caused by a player.

      When the toggle request was not caused by a player (e.g. via redstone) and this value is not set, it will default to the prime owner of the door.

      Specified by:
      responsible in interface DoorToggleRequestBuilder.IBuilder
      Parameters:
      responsible - The player responsible for the toggle request. The responsible player's build-permissions are used for things like checking access to certain areas.
      Returns:
      The next step of the guided builder process.

    • messageReceiver

      public DoorToggleRequestBuilder.IBuilder messageReceiver(IMessageable messageReceiver)
      Description copied from interface: DoorToggleRequestBuilder.IBuilder
      Optional: Sets the message receiver of the toggle request. The message receiver will receive all messages related to the toggle request.

      When the toggle request is caused by a player, this defaults to that player. In all other situations, it defaults to the server.

      Specified by:
      messageReceiver in interface DoorToggleRequestBuilder.IBuilder
      Parameters:
      messageReceiver - The message receiver for all messages related to the toggle request.
      Returns:
      The next step of the guided builder process.
